body: Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Not at all; I'll submit a new PR after I have everything passing locally.  (It doesn't look like it's possible to reopen PRs that have been merged.)  Thanks again.
Good catch. The existing code fails when the `logDir` includes `file://`. This LGTM.

Jenkins, retest this please.

I'm fine to have this is a workaround for 1.0. I'll make a JIRA describing the broader issue and we can fix it for 1.1.

Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/14014/

Test failure here:

```
[info] - trivial job cancellation *** FAILED *** (2 milliseconds)
[info]   "Job 0 cancelled[ ]" did not equal "Job 0 cancelled[]" (DAGSchedulerSuite.scala:293)
[info]   org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException:
```

Seems like maybe a simple string format issue?
LGTM - Might be useful to add (or keep a note) that the mesos and Hadoop2 versions should match for things to work and refer the mesos JIRA ?
Ya - let's also hold off on merging this for a minute, want to understand what happens with Hadoop 1 builds now that we've upgraded to mesos 0.17
This should be backported to 0.9 and 1.0

BTW this is a much bigger issue with iPython notebook -- if you're running in the console, you get the wrong error (with parsing the int) but also the correct error.  If you're running in iPython notebook, you only get the wrong error, making this very annoying to debug.

We may have to revert this because of the protobuf dependency issue. I think this might cause Spark to not work for users building against Hadoop versions that use protobuf < 2.5.0. Testing a bit locally now.
Hey, unfortunately this no longer merges cleanly. Do you mind rebasing it? I think some conflicting changes happened in MLUtils.
Merged build finished. All automated tests passed.

All automated tests passed.
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/14016/
I reverted this due to an issue with some hadoop versions. Unless mesos shade's their protobuf dependency I don't see us being able to upgrade.
Yes. It is a format issue. Updated the test.
Sure, making a subclass of NewHadoopRDD sounds fine. Thanks!

@tyro89 Thanks for the fix, makes sense. Would you mind creating a JIRA for this on the Spark issue tracker? Also if there is a symptom or error that this causes that would be helpful to know (I'd guess it's just seeing the None key in multiple places on the reduce side of the shuffle).

Otherwise if people run into this it will be hard for them to learn where/when it was fixed.

Jenkins, retest this please
